page.title: 13Local History Warstones Area
page.content: The Warstones estate was built by a firm called Mucklow whose motto was a house a day. The houses were built between 1936 and 1939. They are mainly semi-detached, and have had garages added since the Second World War. Before the estate was built there were just fields, streams and ponds in the area. There was also a farm called Bate's Farm which sold milk. The farm was where Hollybush Lane is now. The Hollybush Pub was built in 1946 replacing an earlier one. The cost of a house then would have been from about 320 pounds to 400 pounds. The price of the same house today would be about 21,000 pounds. Warstones Road used to be called Watery Lane because of the streams and ponds.
